Fixes #1679

Issues.Body:

with the new ci leg up, we wont have to test the changes locally for netcoreapp3.0

Issues.Title: [WIP] Addition of the ValueMappingEstimator and ValueMappingTransform.
Issues.Body:
This will be replacing the TermLookupTransform and provide a way to
specify the mapping betweeen two values (note this is specified and not
trained). A user can specify the mapping by providing a keys list and
values list that must be equal in size. The Estimator will then generate
a 1-1 mapping based on the two lists.

The PR references #754 which covers the conversion of Transformer to use
the new Estimator API.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[WIP] Addition of the ValueMappingEstimator and ValueMappingTransform." (#1710)

Issues.Title: Provide methods to train with validation context and initial predictor
Issues.Body:
Tests incoming...
Fix #752
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Provide methods to train with validation context and initial predictor" (#1709)

Issues.Title: Add MLContext.Data extensions for schema comprehension
Issues.Body:
- Move `AsEnumerable<T>` to `Microsoft.ML`. 
- Move `AsCursorable<T>` to `Microsoft.ML.Data`: I'm not sure if it's ever useful, so let's at least get it out of people's faces. Maybe `internal-best-friend` it.
- Add `MLContext.Data.ReadFromCollection<T>` (instead of `env.CreateDataView` and `env.CreateStreamingDataView`).
- Add `MLContext.Model.MakePredictionFunction` as an alternative to `model.MakePredictionFunction`. Maybe still turn it into `Create`? @TomFinley ?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add MLContext.Data extensions for schema comprehension" (#1708)

Issues.Title: Merge API assembly into Data
Issues.Body:
Go over `Microsoft.ML.Api` in the following fashion:

- For all code that is currently used by our code or tests, move it to `Microsoft.ML.Data`.
  - This, I assume, will include all schema propagation, `PredictionEngine` (but not Batch), and `CustomMappingEstimator` and probably the `StatefulFilter` for the time series.
- For all code that is needed by TLC, move back to TLC.
  - I'm not aware of any such code at the moment.
- For code that is not used by either, remove.

After this, remove `Microsoft.ML.Api`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Merge API assembly into Data" (#1707)

Issues.Title: Final interface of SchemaShape
Issues.Body:
1. Move to `Microsoft.ML.Data`
2. `internal-best-friend` all methods that are not accessing columns.
3. Make `SchemaShape` be a `IReadOnlyList<SchemaShape.Column>`
4. Add an accessor by name, and `GetColumnOrNull`, like `Schema` has.
5. Make `SchemaShape.Column` a `struct`.
6. Remove `SchemaException`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Final interface of SchemaShape" (#1706)

Issues.Title: Make members of leaf assemblies internal
Issues.Body:
Similar to #1602, let's make as many members of these assemblies internal as possible.

This applies to all assemblies other than `Core`, `Data` and `Transforms`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make members of leaf assemblies internal" (#1705)

Issues.Body: Similar to #1602, let's make as many members of these assemblies internal as possible

Issues.Title: Final public API for remaining learners
Issues.Body:
Part of #1698 

Let's make good public classes for trained artifacts of:
- `FFM`
- `Naive Bayes`
- `PCAAnomaly`
- `MF`
- Any other trainers not covered in sub-issues of #1698 

- Move to an appropriate namespace inside `Microsoft.ML`
- Reduce the public surface
- Add public constructor
- Add a sample
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Final public API for remaining learners" (#1703)

Issues.Title: Final public API for linear learners
Issues.Body:
Part of #1698 

Let's make `LinearModelParameters` a good public class for Linear models' trained artifacts.
This applies to all linear models (SDCA, LR, SymSgd, OLS etc.)

- Move to `Microsoft.ML.StandardLearners` or an appropriate namespace
- Reduce the public surface
- Add public constructor
- Add a sample
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Final public API for linear learners" (#1702)

Issues.Body:

This applies to all descendants of `FastTreePredictionWrapper`.

- Reduce the public surface

Issues.Body:
Part of #1698

- Reduce the public surface
- Add public constructor
- Add a sample
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Final public API for KMeans predictor" (#1699)

Issues.Title: Final public API for predictor classes
Issues.Body:
1. All predictor classes should be named `SoAndSoModelParameters` (like `KMeansModelParameters`, `LinearBinaryModelParameters` etc. 

2. Strive to remove unnecessary interfaces from the public API: thinks like `IPredictor`, `IPredictorProducing<float>` etc. should not be public. 

3. Review the public surface of `ModelParameters` to enable ONLY parameter introspection. For example:
  - `KMeans` should only expose centroid coordinates.
  - `Linear` should only expose weights/biases.

4. If possible, try to add public constructors. For example:
  - Make it possible to create `KMeansModelParameters` from centroid coordinates
  - Make it possible to create `LinearBinaryModelParameters` from weights and biases
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Final public API for predictor classes" (#1698)

Issues.Title: Remove references to Runtime namespaces from all samples
Issues.Body:
As part of the grand rename of namespaces, let's finalize the set of namespaces of public-facing components.

In this issue, let's perform a simple test:
- For each of the `API Scenarios` tests, make sure that there is no need to reference any `Runtime` namespace.
  - This will of course mean that we'll have to move things out of `Runtime`, like `IDataView` `AsEnumerable` etc.

Namespaces should be:

| Test | Namespaces |
| ---  | --- |
| CrossValidation.cs | `Microsoft.ML` only |
| DecomposableTrainAndPredict.cs |  `Microsoft.ML` only |
| Evaluation.cs | `Microsoft.ML` only |
| Extensibility.cs | `Microsoft.ML` only |
| FileBasedSavingOfData.cs | `Microsoft.ML` only |
| IntrospectiveTraining.cs | `Microsoft.ML` and an appropriate trainer namespace | 
| Metacomponents.cs | `Microsoft.ML` only |
| MultithreadedPrediction.cs | `Microsoft.ML` only |
| ReconfigurablePrediction.cs | `Microsoft.ML` and the namespace for prediction transformer | 
| SimpleTrainAndPredict.cs | `Microsoft.ML` only |
| TrainSaveModelAndPredict.cs | `Microsoft.ML` only |
| TrainWithInitialPredictor.cs | `Microsoft.ML` only |
| TrainWithValidationSet.cs | `Microsoft.ML` only |
| Visibility.cs | `Microsoft.ML` only |
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove references to Runtime namespaces from all samples" (#1697)

Issues.Title: (Azure Stream Analytics) Multivariate support for time series anomaly detection
Issues.Body:
### System information

- **OS version/distro**:  All
- **.NET Version (eg., dotnet --info)**: All

### Issue
- **What did you do?** Azure Stream Analytics is currently running a private preview of built-in Anomaly Detection ML models. 

- **What happened?** In our discussions with several customers in private preview, lack of support for multi-variate A/D is coming up as a blocker to have them fully operationalize their hot path pipelines with this core feature. The list of customers include: 
1) Azure IoT Central (IoT SaaS solution) which uses Stream Analytics under the covers and are expected to grow to supporting '000s of IoT deployment by mid 2019. They require support for upto 4 variables.
2) Stanley Black and Decker
3) ATOS - European SI's IoT practice that works with many customers to build end to end IoT solutions. 

- **What did you expect?** N/A

### Source code / logs N/A

Please paste or attach the code or logs or traces that would be helpful to diagnose the issue you are reporting.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "(Azure Stream Analytics) Multivariate support for time series anomaly detection" (#1696)

Issues.Title: Separate assembly for statically typed API extensions
Issues.Body:
There should be a greater separation between the statically typed API and the dynamic API, so that users are more aware of which one they are using. Ideally the statically typed extensions should live in a separate assembly, but they should at least be in a separate namespace.

Currently some extensions for the statically typed API are not under the StaticPipe namespace. From preliminary search the following estimators seem to have extensions that are not under Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe:
https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/dd46276cc257e20fe09239aeedb2f25c4bded6dd/src/Microsoft.ML.Transforms/MissingValueIndicatorTransformer.cs
https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/dd46276cc257e20fe09239aeedb2f25c4bded6dd/src/Microsoft.ML.Data/Transforms/KeyToValue.cs
https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/dd46276cc257e20fe09239aeedb2f25c4bded6dd/src/Microsoft.ML.Transforms/KeyToVectorMapping.cs
https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/e74bc65524430a1e0ed06912bdb5c6c21ef8d158/src/Microsoft.ML.Transforms/Text/TextFeaturizingEstimator.cs
https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/dd46276cc257e20fe09239aeedb2f25c4bded6dd/src/Microsoft.ML.Transforms/MissingValueReplacing.cs
https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/dd46276cc257e20fe09239aeedb2f25c4bded6dd/src/Microsoft.ML.Data/Transforms/KeyToVector.cs
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Separate assembly for statically typed API extensions" (#1695)

Issues.Title: Rename mlContext.Data.TextReader() to mlContext.Data.CreateTextLoader()
Issues.Body:
Since the object being created is a "TextLoader", I'd recommend the method's name to say so, instead of "TextReader" which looks like a different type. 

I mean code like the following feels confusing:

```
            TextLoader textLoader = mlContext.Data.TextReader(new TextLoader.Arguments()
                                                    {
                                                        Separator = "tab",
                                                        HasHeader = true,
                                                        Column = new[]
                                                                    {
                                                                    new TextLoader.Column("Label", DataKind.Bool, 0),
                                                                    new TextLoader.Column("Text", DataKind.Text, 1)
                                                                    }
                                                    });
```

In addition to that, methods should have a verb as part of the name, so if what it is doing is to create a TextReader, let's say so, as:

mlContext.Data.CreateTextLoader()

We're not being consistent now when having some methods with a verb but other methods just a noun:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1712635/48811328-18f0d300-ece2-11e8-8d31-2e2fad81ab60.png)

It is also against C# conventions (and most languages). A method's name should have a verb describing the action being performed by that method:

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/design-guidelines/names-of-type-members#names-of-methods
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Rename mlContext.Data.TextReader() to mlContext.Data.CreateTextLoader()" (#1690)

Issues.Title: Include the "save file" action (.ZIP file) as part of model.SaveFile()
Issues.Body:
Currently, whenever we are saving a .ZIP model file, you always need to handle the code for the File stream class.

I think that is repetitive code that could be included in the API.
Instead of:

```
using (var fs = new FileStream(ModelPath, FileMode.Create, FileAccess.Write, FileShare.Write))
                mlContext.Model.Save(trainedModel, fs);
```

We could have an overridden method so I could simply do the following:

`mlContext.Model.Save(trainedModel, modelPath);`

Or even the following, if those methods were part of the model class itself instead of a utility class in the MLContext:

`model.Save(modelPath);`

Currently, this kind of line using the file stream class is something you need to repeat over and over in every/most training app (even when the constructor can be simplified):

`using (var fs = new FileStream(ModelPath, FileMode.Create, FileAccess.Write, FileShare.Write))`

Handling a FileStream object might should not be mandatory for the user **but optional**:

Of course, I would also maintain the current methods because in some cases you might want to just provide an existing stream object, but as opt-in.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Include the "save file" action (.ZIP file) as part of model.SaveFile()" (#1689)

Issues.Title: CpuMath has a bad project reference to ML.Core
Issues.Body:
See https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/pull/1659#discussion_r235195505

We recently made CpuMath depend on ML.Core, but this is broken.

The `Microsoft.ML` nuget package depends on the `Microsoft.ML.CpuMath` NuGet package.  So having the CpuMath.dll depend on `Microsoft.ML.Core` is backwards.

See https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/pull/542 for the reasoning why this was done that way.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CpuMath has a bad project reference to ML.Core" (#1688)
